trait.name: Unlearned Displacement {@recharge 5}
entries: The displacer cub projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn at which point it must roll a 5 or 6 on a d6. This trait is also disrupted while the little beast is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

trait.name: Cry For Help
entries: For its turn, the cub ushers a cry for help if it feels threatened or lost. Roll on the Cry for Help table below to see what occurs.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The displacer cub makes two attacks with its tentacles.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +3} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

This diminutive predator is the child version of a displacer beast. A displacer cub resembles a sleek, great cat covered in blue-black fur. Its otherworldly origins are clear in its six legs and the two tentacles sprouting from its shoulders, both ending in smooth pads.

trait.name: Keen Displacement
entries: The displacer elder projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until an attack against it misses or the end of its next turn, whichever is sooner. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the displacer elder is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Cry For Help
entries: For its turn, the cub ushers a cry for help if it feels threatened or lost. Roll on the Cry for Help table below to see what occurs.

trait.name: Steel Mind
entries: The elder displacer beast is immune to being charmed.

trait.name: Hind Legs
entries: The displacer elder can use half its movement to rest on its four hind legs to attack with a bite and its two front paws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elder displacer beast makes two attacks with its tentacles or pounces at one target. If on its hind legs, it instead makes three melee attacks: two claw attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, range 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Pounce {@recharge 5}
entries: The elder displacer beast uses half its movement to leap towards a target with 20 ft. It then makes one Bite attack against the target with advantage. On a hit, and if the target is Medium or smaller, the target must succeed a DC 16 Strength check or be knocked prone.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

This monstrous predator is the elder version of a displacer beast, a beast that takes its name from its ability to displace light so that it appears to be several feet away from its actual location. A displacer elder resembles a sleek, great cat covered in gray-black fur. However, its otherworldly origins are clear in its six legs and the two tentacles sprouting from its shoulders, both ending in pads tipped with spiky protrusions. A displacer elder's eyes glow with an awful malevolence that persists even in death.

trait.name: Sound Mimicry
entries: Parrots are excellent at learning and copying sounds they hear often, from creaking boards to even specific voices. The parrot makes a Deception check opposed by the listener’s Insight check to recognize the mimicry, although if the listener isn’t keenly familiar with the person or type of sounds mimicked, it gains disadvantage on the Insight check. The parrot has a +8 racial bonus on its Deception check to mimic sounds it has listened to for at least 1 week. This ability does not allow the parrot to speak or understand languages, it simply imitates them.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

This brightly-colored bird has a strong, curved bill and stands almost two feet tall. The sparkle in its eyes belie a clear intelligence greater than that many other animals possess. Parrots are natural mimics, and are famed for their ability to repeat words and short phrases they have been taught. They are seed eaters, and not generally aggressive, but their powerful beaks are fully capable of severing a finger that is poked too close to them. They can manipulate objects using their feet and beaks with enough dexterity to put a key in a lock and turn it if they have been trained to do so.

trait.name: Corrupted Weapons
entries: The Corrupted Deva's weapon attacks are magical. When the Corrupted Deva hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 psychic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Corrupted Deva makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Iron Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +8} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, plus {@h}16 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Mind Rend
entries: The Corrupted Deva links its warped mind with that of one creature within 30 ft. The target must make a DC 17 Charisma save or be stunned until the end of their next turn. If they fail this check by 5 or more they also take {@h}27 (@damage 6d8) psychic damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Corrupted Deva's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Shinoh is an 11th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks), he has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Corrupted Weapons
entries: Tempani's weapon attacks are magical. When she hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 6d8 psychic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Warped Awareness
entries: If Tempani looks a creature in the eyes, she knows its greatest fear.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Tempani has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Tempani makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +15} to hit, range 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) slashing damage, plus {@h}27 ({@damage 6d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Word of Truth
entries: Tempani whispers a horrible truth of the Far Realms into the mind of one creature within 30 ft. The target must make a {@dc 25} Charisma save or take {@h}27 ({@damage 6d8}) psychic damage. If they fail this check by 10 or more they are dominated by Tempani until the end of their next turn and suffer the effect of one short-term madness.

action.name: Merge (only available when below half hp)
entries: Tempani reaches out to an Elder Being within 5ft. and merges with it, transforming into the Divine Horror.

legendary.name: Options
entries: Tempani can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Tempani regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Tempani magically teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 120 ft. to an unoccupied space she can see.

legendary.name: Maddening Burst (2 actions)
entries: Tempani emits a burst of psychic energy. Each creature of her choice in a 10 ft. radius must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity save, taking {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage plus {@h}14 ({damage 4d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Tempani's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 25}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

trait.name: Twisted Hands
entries: The Elder Being's weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 8d8 psychic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Impossible Flesh
entries: The Elder Being's body does not obey conventional laws of biology or geometry. When a creature hits the Elder Being with an attack it must roll a d20. On a result of less than ten, the attack misses.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Elder Being has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Warping Aura
entries: All creatures that come within 20 ft. of the Elder Being, or who start their turn within 20 ft., must roll on the following chart:

entries.caption: Warping Aura Effect
rows: {@The creature becomes highly magnetised.} For each non-secured source of metal within 30 ft. (creatures count as singly sources, no matter how many items they are carrying) they are subjected to a ranged attack made with a {@hit 10} to hit, causing {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6+3}) bludgeoning damage on a hit. Creatures holding metal items may attempt to hold onto them by making a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw.

{@b The ground around the creature momentarily liquefies.} If the creature is standing on solidground they must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be restrained. As an action, they or another creatures within 5 ft. can attempt to free them, requiring a {@dc 18} Strength (Athletics) check.
{b Gravity reverses for the creature.} They begin to fall upwards at a rate of 60 ft. per turn. This lasts until the beginning of their next turn.
{@b The creature is caught in a brief time loop.} They must attempt to repeat the actions of their previous turn. This does not consume any extra resources (spell slots, items, etc.).
{@b The creature skips forward in time.} They disappear from play and reappear at the start of their next turn.

{@b An alien presence filters into their mind.} They must make a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw or be stunned until the start of their next turn. On as success, however, they gain a portion of it’s intellect, increasing their Intelligence to 30 for one minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Elder Being makes one smash attack and one dread gaze attack.

action.name: Smash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +17} to hit, range 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage, plus {@h}36 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Dread Gaze
entries: The Elder Being turns its gaze upon one creature that can see it. The target must make a {@dc 25} Charisma saving throw or suffer the effects of the {@spell confusion} spell.

trait.name: Corrupted Soul
entries: The Divine Horror’s weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 10d8 psychic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Divine Horror has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
entries: If the Divine Horror fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Warping Aura
entries: All creatures that come within 20 ft. of the Divine Horror, or who start their turn within 20 ft., must roll on the following chart:

entries.caption: Warping Aura Effect
rows: {@The creature becomes highly magnetised.} For each non-secured source of metal within 30 ft. (creatures count as singly sources, no matter how many items they are carrying) they are subjected to a ranged attack made with a {@hit 10} to hit, causing {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6+3}) bludgeoning damage on a hit. Creatures holding metal items may attempt to hold onto them by making a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw.

{@b The ground around the creature momentarily liquefies.} If the creature is standing on solidground they must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be restrained. As an action, they or another creatures within 5 ft. can attempt to free them, requiring a {@dc 18} Strength (Athletics) check.
{b Gravity reverses for the creature.} They begin to fall upwards at a rate of 60 ft. per turn. This lasts until the beginning of their next turn.
{@b The creature is caught in a brief time loop.} They must attempt to repeat the actions of their previous turn. This does not consume any extra resources (spell slots, items, etc.).
{@b The creature skips forward in time.} They disappear from play and reappear at the start of their next turn.

{@b An alien presence filters into their mind.} They must make a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw or be dominted by the Divine Horror until the start of their next turn and gain the effect of a short-term madness. On as success, however, they gain a portion of it’s intellect, increasing their Intelligence to 30 for one minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Elder Being makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +17} to hit, range 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage, plus {@h}40 ({@damage 10d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Mind Rend
entries: The Divine Horror tears into the mind of all creatures within 30 ft. The target must make a {@dc 25} Charisma save or take {@h}36 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage and gain one level of exhaustion.

legendary.name: Options
entries: The Divine Horror can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Divine Horror regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Dread Gaze
entries: The Divine Horror turns its gaze upon one creature that can see it. The target must make a {@dc 25} Charisma saving throw or suffer the effects of the {@spell confusion} spell.

legendary.name: Time Jump
entries: The Divine Horror teleports to any location it occupied during its previous turn.

legendary.name: Writhing Charge
entries: The Divine Horror moves up to its speed and makes a greatsword attack with advantage against one target.
